dt: {bc}an open receptacle with a flat bottom and a low rim for holding, carrying, or exhibiting articles

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}trīg, trēg{/it}; akin to Old Swedish {it}trø{/it} wooden grain measure and probably to Old English {it}trēow{/it} tree {ma}{mat|tree:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: an open receptacle with a flat bottom and a low rim for holding, carrying, or exhibiting articles

dt: {bc}a rectangular metal sheet with a rolled edge used for baking {bc}{sx|baking sheet||}

dt.t: Lay the dough sticks on a {wi}baking tray{/wi} lined with nonstick paper and bake for 35–40 minutes, until golden and crisp.

shortdef: a rectangular metal sheet with a rolled edge used for baking : baking sheet

dt: {bc}a tray that accommodates a tea set

shortdef: a tray that accommodates a tea set

dt: {bc}a box or other container on a desk in which letters, notes, etc., that are sent to the desk are placed

dt.t: an {it}in tray{/it} full of letters that have to be answered

shortdef: a box or other container on a desk in which letters, notes, etc., that are sent to the desk are placed

dt: {bc}a container holding dry material (called litter) that is used as a toilet by animals (especially cats) while they are indoors

shortdef: a container holding dry material (called litter) that is used as a toilet by animals (especially cats) while they are indoors

dt: {bc}a box or other container on a desk in which letters, notes, etc., that are being sent from the desk are placed

shortdef: a box or other container on a desk in which letters, notes, etc., that are being sent from the desk are placed
